author: Takeshi
title: Warning! Heavy Machinery!
review:
This is a really good set. It includes the Claw Digger, Sufurix rock monster, and two neon green energy crystals. (This is especially good if you had some of the older Rock Raiders sets)

Claw Digger
Pros: Sturdy design, new roll gage piece, new dynamite piece (awesome), new huge wheels, awesome engine. Also has a convieniently placed shovel bucket for scooping up crystals. This is one set where you want the stickers. Some of them are textured and can glow in the dark!

cons: The wheels, being solid plastic, don't spin on smooth surfaces. Also, if you put down the shovel too far on textured surfaces (e.g. a rug) and move it forward, it will catch on the surface and possibly snap off (but don't worry, it'll snap back on!)

Sulfurix
Pros: poseable arms, and can hold two crystals in his mouth if you put them in just right.

cons: His legs don't move, and he's a bit smaller than anticipated.

Summary: Good set, but don't let the pictures fool you. It is just a bit smaller than you may think

author: legojango
title: WAY better than I expected
review:
This set is very good for anyone who likes ank rockmonsters or are in need of lime-green peices. I will just list my Pros and cons.

Pros:

Includes rock monster :)

Sturdy (will not break easily)

Texturized stickers (There can't be tecturized peices, that would be lame)

Could be used as a construction set if you take off the claw aarms.

Awesome new wheels

Cons:

Sulfrix is lime-green instead of yellow :(

Can onlt be driven on low carpet or LEGO baseplates :[




Over all I would recomend this set and I think it was meant to only drive on LEGO base plates so you can go buy some OR for the new base comming out. Could be?!?

author: dragon_teenager
title: Surprisingly good
review:
Power Miners aren't as good as Rock Raiders, but their sets aren't as bad as many have made them out to be. This vehicle, for instance, is very cool, with some awesome new parts and great detail.

This set is great because it's a relatively cheap way to get the awesome new wheels, and the look of the model itself is very cool. It looks like a mining machine (if you ignore the color scheme) and the pickaxe-arms come down with a satisfying clunk. It also has a great looking engine in the back, which is possibly the best engine I've seen from an official set. Nicely done there. 

On the down side, the set is much smaller than I expected. Also, I don't like how the gray sticks poke out of the back wheels... I feel that could have been resolved by the designers pretty easily. It should have been about five dollars cheaper, but by today's standards this set really isn't that badly priced; I wouldn't let that keep you away unless you're on a budget. 

All in all, this is a good set, one of the better out of the Power Miners line. I recommend it.

author: andy87
title: wow!
review:
i really like this one!

Pros:
sweet monetser and miner
huge wheels make it easy to move
it has a shovel on the front
two headlight
an ax, a saw and dynomite all included

cons:
smaller then expected
the monseter is also small

author: IlovePowerMiners
title: Mysterious Rumblings have struck the globe...
review:
First off, that is part of the LEGO shop@ home's Power Miners storyline. The Claw Digger is an AWESOME set. I got it for Xmas (actually, Xmas eve). Staight out of the box, it had some pieces I didn't have in my collection yet. Build time wasn't long, but the result was AWESOME! It had the HUGE tires, the shovel, and, of course, the claw arms. Let's get on to the Pros and Cons.

Pros: Pickax
         Dynamite
         HUGE tires
         Claws
         Sulfurix
         Rex
         Big

Cons: Claws drag on ground
                                              I give it 9 out of 5 stars 



                            So get out there and buy it... Please?

author: JBH75
title: Smash those rocks and Sulfurix
review:
This was the third Power Miner Set that I got. It is so cool. The claw arms reach up and slam the rock and then collect the crystals. When Sulfurix shows up you can throw dynamite at him, or cut him with the pickaxe or the saw. Here's a list of Pros and cons:

Pros:
Dynamite, Pickaxe, saw
Two light green neon crystals
Sulfurix!!
Super cool tires
Nice engine
Roll cage

Cons:
Shovel in front breaks on carpet surfaces if kept too low!! (will easily come on)
Should've put a 3rd claw in the middle of the other 2

That's it. All in All, the claw digger is a great set, and you should get it soon!!"

author: Pepper
title: my first Power Miners set
review:
As the title states, this was my first Power Miners set. I got it with birthday money earlier this month. It's so cool! Both the rock monster and miner are awesome.

pros.
-Rex
-Sulfurix
-awesome vehicle
-pickaxe, buzz saw, dynamite, and 2 crystals
-cool pieces
-nice stickers
-awesome engine
-digging function
-price is perfect

cons.
-too many white pieces show
-shovel in front doesn't pick up crystals without help
-some of the stickers should have been printed (not the textured ones)
-hole in the floor alows for drafts
-no rocks to put the crystals in and smash

The cons don't make me drop any points because this set is just so cool. If you have the chance, get this set, it's awesome!

author: soothsayer95
title: well worth it
review:
Guess where I got this set. LEGOLAND, two days ago
This set is cool

PROS:
        sulfurix
        orange pieces
        

CONS:
         engine top not metalic
         few different pieces





Get this set if you like power miners

author: SaintElsewhere
title: Very good
review:
I never got a single Rock Raiders set, so while some are saying that Power Miners is a blatant rip-off of Rock Raiders, I welcome it.
  The Claw Digger is very well-built and I am guessing it could easily withstand underground cave-ins, rock slides, et al. The wheels and engine are oversized & powerful, perfect for going over rock. I like the roll cage and the headlamps but am not a big fan of the scoop.
  The miner is neat and I really like the rock monster, which is kind of cute in a mischievous, evil sort of way. The accessories are all brilliant, from the crystals
to the new dynamite piece. (WAY better than the old 2x1 SNOT tiles with the dynamite painted on.)  

Can't wait to get more of these!

author: legoreviewer
title: Awsome Set!
review:
This set is awsome. When I fist saw it, I thought it didn't look the part, but for some reason it happened to find a way into my heart and when I saw it at my local Wal-Mart, I just had to get it. So anyways, here's the review.

Minifigs: Miner- The miner is your basic miner that we have all seen but this guy is an engineer. His helmet is the same and comes with no goggles. His head has some scars and stubble on it and looks pretty cool. But I'm not a big fan of the scared face side.
Sulfurix- A trans-green or yellow monster. Nothing too special here.

Claw Digger: A really nice design with about five or so stickers. The claws unfortunetly do not move when the Digger is in motion. You have to turn the nobs on the side to move the claws. A slight dissapointment considering the fact that they could've done it. I like the new wheel pieces which appear in most of the PM sets. There are three equipment holders in the vehicle. Good for storing pick axes or shovels etc. There is an engine on the back that is very detailed and looks great. Nothing much more to say except; If you are a Power Miners fan!

author: Doek5554
title: The Claw Digger!
review:
This is probably the favorite Power miner set i have!

Pros:
- Sulfurix
-the 2 sided head miner
-2 crystals
-dynamite
-engine
-roll-cage
-big black wheels
-smashers

Cons:

overall 5 out of 5. Power miners is a really good theme and you should get any power miner set.

author: Toa_Of_Justice
title: Pros, Cons, and Suggested Modifications
review:
I was quite interested in the Claw Digger when I first saw pictures of it. However, I was hesitant to buy this model because some reviewers were complaining about design flaws, such as the fact that without modifications, the bucket up front can't pick up crystals very well. I will now summarize the pros and cons of this model, along with a few suggested modifications:

+Pros (12)+

+ Swinging claws that work very well
+ Front bucket which moves up and down
+ Opening cockpit with a seat and controls inside
+ Tools that be stored on the vehicle
+ Huge detailed engine
+ Giant wheels (each one is about 2.5 inches in diameter) that can roll on just about any surface
+ Glow-in-the-dark stickers
+ Two crystals, both of which can fit in the rock monster if inserted carefully
+ Rock monster (Sulfurix) with opening mouth
+ Miner minifigure (Rex) with two facial expressions
+ The model doesn't take up too much space on a shelf
+ Good price to parts ratio (considering all the large and special parts in this model)

-Cons (4)-

- Claws drag when the vehicle moves (Easy built-in fix: The claws can be tilted up and made to rest on two little stubs on each side of the model.)
- The bucket up front can't pick up crystals very well (Somewhat easy fix: Add a "Link 1M Fric/Fork/Stumpf" [available in quite a few recent sets and through Pick A Brick] in between the bucket and its mounting point on the Claw Digger. This will allow the bucket to lay flat enough to scoop up crystals.)
- The very rear part of the engine wobbles sometimes (Unfortunately, I can't think of a way to fix this flaw aside from removing this part from the engine)
- No rocks for the Claw Digger to smash apart (unless you count the rock monster)

*Other*

* A communications antenna can be added to the roll cage. Just use the included extra control stick (and any of the other extra pieces, if you wish).

*Overall*

With my modifications, I think you'll really like this set!

author: BionicFlamer
title: Minerrific!
review: This Claw Digger is actually a really nice set but I was not expecting Sulfurix to be light green because in lego.com in product pages and in bios section, it showed sulfurix as yeallow like yellow lemons and when I realized him light green it was very strange. Another thing is that the claws should be in mid air because when you ride through ground and floors the claws are scraping against the ground or floor and makes the lego look like no reality at all but I was amazed by the texture of the stickers.

author: Bricknave
title: *Ching ching ching, wirrr*  The Claw Digger is ready to mine!
review:
This is a good medium sized set with some very nice bricks!

Pros:
Supercharged engine!   *Vroom vroom*
Orange blades are great for Bionicle fans
Cool slanted lime green bricks and lime green plates!
Very very playable!!  You can have fun with the knob-claw function.
Two crystals instead of one.

Cons:
The map is outside of the cockpit (wouldn't it get dirty?)
Only two of the tools are on the back of the vehicle, the other one is behind the cockpit.

Although it doesn't have many small pieces, it is still a good set to add to your Power Miners collection!

~Bricknave

author: michaelvader
title: MOVE OUT OF THE WAY!- Rex
review:
I love it the arms move up and down and its a really good set.

pros:
MINIFIGS
4 HUGE wheels
THE MOVEING UP AND DOWN ARMS
huge and awesome engine
Just everything!

cons:
none

5/5 or 10/10

author: merkinized75
title: Heavy machinery ready to roll!
review:
This clawish mean machine is not just awesome-looking, it's so sturdy built that you can't rip it apart even if you try your best. When you grab those handles on the side and rotate them, the claws move up and down and hack EVERYTHING in its way. The good thing is it came with two crystals(good for Sulfurix). The wheels are HUGE, I mean HUGE. And behind the roll-cage there are big floodlights. On the very front there is a scoop-basket so you can give a seat to those rockies and their crystals. On the back there is a dynamite and a saw. You can actually take off the engine by removing the pickax and then you stuck your finger below and then pull it up.

Pros:
 

  • moving claws
  • big wheels
  • floodlights
  • sturdy and challenging build
  • scoop-basket
  • oversized engine
  • nice mud texture on the stickers

Cons:
 

  • cross-axle going out of the back wheels
  • antennas instead of a driving wheel
  • computer isn't where it should be
  • some gaps below the vehicle

author: TransformR
title: uhh, how do we dig with these?
review:
This set is great, but it has drawbacks: the claws don't move twards the bucket any and when it is rolling the claws can catch on something and stop the vehicle.

Now on to the review

Pros:

Tool storage at different places on the vehicle

Two crystals!

huge engine

Pros:

Drawbacks mentioned above

 

And all in all, this set is great if you want to get the Power Miners "ball" rolling.

author: Alemas
title: My NEW second favourite set!
review:
This set is so good it displaces Makuta Icarax for my second favourite set! The features this set include are:

  • Smashing claws
  • Tiltable bucket
  • Openable roll-cage
  • And antennae that actually reach the minifig's hands! :)

Building experience

Well, not much to say. I'm a quick builder, but it took me... about 15 minutes, if not more, to build this. Overall, a very enjoyable build.

Parts

Pretty good selection. You get a rock monster and a Rex minifig. Plus a bucket, 2 crystals, digging claws, off-roading wheels(which are hard plastic), a pick-axe, a piece of dynamite, and some useful engine pieces.

Playability

SO good. You can smash things with the claws! Unfortunately, the bucket doesn't work, but on bed sheets, it CAN collect crystals.

Value for money

Eeerm... I'm no expert in this, but judging from Brickset's mentioned price(£15.65), I say it's REALLY good for what you get!

Pros:

  • Smashing claws
  • Tiltable bucket
  • Openable roll-cage
  • Great playability
  • Good selection of parts
  • Great value for money

Cons:

  • Bucket doesn't work on smooth surfaces

Overall, a superb set! Get it if you can! You will not be disappointed! ;)

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Power Miners - Claw Digger
review:
The Claw Digger set (8959) is a LEGO Power Miners set which came out in 2009. It comes with 2 minifigs and 197 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8959-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

Rex: Rex comes with the 2009 LEGO Power Miners uniform which is double-printed. The legs are printed and he has a double-printed face. His helmet is blue.

Sulfrix: Sulfix is a mini monster whose head mouth is able to open. You can put in the 2 crystals in it which comes with this set. He also has some nice evil looking eyes.

Claw Digger:

The Claw Digger set is very awsome and attractive. It comes with some cool new wheels (the wheels got released in 2009), a shovel which does sviwel. The roll cage does open nicely and you can see a chair with 2 joysticks. Behind the rollcage you can find a pickax and 2 nice headlights. On the left and on the right you can see a claw which you can move up and down. When I've seen the first pictures before it came out I thought that the claws will move up and down if you move this vehicle around but they don't. On the back you can find a stick of dynamite and a chainsaw. The best thing about this vehicle is probably the design of the engine. This set is really fun to build!

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Engine
Minifigures
Design
Play features
Comes with 2 crystals

Negative:

Claws don't move up and down if you move this vehicle around.
Stickers

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Legojii
title: Bladiy swoosh thingiy
review:
For those lovers of lime colored bricks Power Miners was a godsend. I mean whats not to love about them, heavy rock crushing industrial machines that just happen to collect crystals that are also being sought out my these elementals rock creatures that power up once they consume them. What else can i say but I'm a fan.

I got this set a few days ago at a sale and lets just say it was such a good deal i could not pass it up and i loves it, i have some minor gripes but over all a cool vehicle.

Cons: 
The machine is suppose to be some kind of rock piking and gathering ride for the miners but the gimmick just didn't work for me in the current state so i ended up modifying the arms so it had a swivel and more articulation and i adjusted the pikes so they were not fixed and could move. For such a large machine it only gave you such a small rock monster is OK with me but maybe a gimmick like some gray rocks to crush would have been nice.

Pros: 
Its a mid sized set that feels big, you feel it was worth the money and its just fun. its like a roadster heavy machinery thats ready to rumble. There is nothing in the set thats specific to this set but its the execution and the feel. To me its feel like a solid set with some very minor details i easily remedied. 

Overall a set that will figure well into a good display or be loved by kids with big truck play in mind.

author: benjadude11
title: very good.
review:
I had very high expectations for this set, and many of them were surpassed my only letdown is noted in the 'set itself' section.

minifigs: sulfurix is the coolest rock moster and goes great with geolix from rock wrecker. I also like the head on this power miner. 5/5

price: $20 is a good deal. 5/5 

build: about what i expected, 30 minutes or so. not challenging, but fun. 5/5

set itself: here's the catch in what would be an otherwise perfect set. you need to move the claws MANUALLY. i thought that when you rolled the vehicle the claws would chop up and down, but the didnt, which dissapointed me. on the bright side, however, the cockpit and engine are both excellent. 3/5

playability: the claws affect this section too. however, sulfurix and the extra crystal make up for most of it. this is a rare set that is great for display and also playablity. 4/5

overall: 22/25. buy this set.

author: TheFadedTBCap
title: Smashing Killer Claws
review:
Crashing through all sorts of rocks and/or rock monsters in its way, the Claw Digger is totally AWESOME!

Pros:

- Smashing arms
- Giant engine
- Sulferix
- Includes saw, dynamite, two crystals, and pick ax

Cons:

- Scoop (or plow) doesn't scoop up crystals well

Includes one mini figure, but has 6 stickers (if you don't like stickers). I like this set, it is really cool.

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: Schwing! Crunsh! Schwing...
review:
I must admit in all honesty that I was not impressed with this set on first glance. It looked a little sparse and boring.

I was wrong.

This set was possibly the biggest surprise of 2009, and it was a pleasant surprise, make no mistake! The simplicity made it look rubbish; frankly, it's the simplicity that makes it cool! It has no overriding gimmick, being a vehicle of pure substance. Its primary feature is a pair of scything rock-splitting blade hammers to pound apart any blockages, along with a large bulldozer bucket to clear debris. The blades are made with BIONICLE claws, marking another successful integration of this sort of part into a mining vehicle. Rex is at the controls, putting all his skill into another crystal-rich mission. Out to stop him is Sulfurix, an acid-spewing Rock Monster that can melt tunnels in the rock! He'll stop at nothing to guard his crystals...

The main gripe about this set is the stickers- they're a bit too prevalent in all sets these days, and even the control panel wasn't a transfer! Yeesh, LEGO, loosen the purse strings a tadge! And more Rock Raiders-coloured Crystals? Do I detect repetition?

  • Pros:
  • Good design
  • Rex figure (he's rare, ya know)
  • Sulfurix (if you have no access to the Rock Monster Catapult set, he's unique)
  • Simple yet impressive function of the piston blades
  • Parts are cool (an orange bulldozer bucket!)
  • Cons:
  • Too many stickers
  • More yellowish Crystals? I'm a Rock Raiders fan, no doubt; but this seems a bit like repetition to me...

author: LobsterWarrior
title: WATCH OUT FOR THE CLAWS!
review:
AWESOME! This is almost excellent! I mean, just look at it, with the price LEGO puts these days, it's totally worth $20! The claws here swing with pride! They crack rocks and make stones go boom boom :P. Sulfurix will run and scream by just looking at those claws! The mega-engine is SUPER DETAILED! It's awesome! Just look at those wheels! And that shovel, this set is almost perfect! But with those powerful claws swinging around, Sulfurix needs backup. Some other Rock monster could've been included. Oh well, live and learn right?

 

Pros

  • Sulfurix!
  • Wow! Just look at that engine's details!
  • Those claws...awesome!
  • Massive wheels!
  • You get rare pieces and two crystals

Cons

  • Another Rock Monster couldn't have hurt.

That little con is so little, it's not even bad. So get this set!

author: dixondog
title: AWESOME PM SET!
review:
this is the best PM set EVER! most people like the gears in all the other sets but i like the manual function in this one. it is the best function out of all of them because you control how strong the claws strike. the vehicle is AWESOME! it has a very detailed engine on the back with exhaust pipes the minifigs are cool. rex has a double sided head and some scratches on his face. his shirt has a few tools and a picture of a bomb on it.his helmet is cool. sulfurix is cool though he is the same as all the others except he is a different color.

thanks for reading!

author: Zatth
title: Sulfurix is no match......... no match at all.
review:
When the Power Miners theme first arrived, let me tell you, I was excited. The first set of the new theme that I had my eyes on was the Claw Digger, so I was lucky enough to get it just before the stores went out of stock.

   Firstly, the box art: I am aware that many folks have no care for the box art, so feel free to skip this section. But if you do care, then I'll let you know that the Power Miners series had amazing box imagery. They illustrated all of the action features of the set in several "metal" back-grounded windows, plus the set's accessories and rock monster.

  On to the core of the review: The build. As my rating suggests, you will not be disappointed by the building experience. It is quite short for the size of the set, and very intriguing, most notably the engine. This engine is no cheaply designed element. Of all the Lego sets I have seen, this is the finest, most greebled engine ever. Naturally, many MOC'ers could come up with something better, but for a stock Lego set...........

  About the parts: These parts are terrific for custom creations. You will find lots of technic parts and many fine greebles in this set. The only things lacking are bulky "block" bricks. Despite the sort of pieces used, the Claw Digger comes out feeling very strong and powerful. With the huge engine, monstrous wheels, and sturdy construction, the Claw Digger can take on any terrain. Or it feels like it could.......

  As for playability: The Claw Digger is one of the neatest Power Miners sets to romp around with. It's action, although not "automatic", is certainly the most powerful action in the series and can tear up any creation or creature in its path. Very satisfying. However, a problem arises if this is the only PM set you get: Sulfurix stands absolutely no chance. He has no real attack power, compared to the other monsters. (A bit of storyline: Sulfurix is the most intelligent of the Monsters and has the ability to quickly melt round tunnels ahead of him without having to dig. No special powers for combat.)

  Overall, I would certainly recommend this set. I got it at the price of 19.99, which was well worth it, especially because this was the only set that contained Sulfurix.
